title: Rust bootstrap - x.py --dist using the wrong Cargo.toml location

labels.name: T-bootstrap
labels.description: Relevant to the bootstrap subteam: Rust's build system (x.py and src/bootstrap)

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
Whilst learning how to bootstrap rust for building on different architectures I ran into a strange bug where running `x.py --dist --build i686-unknown-linux-gnu --host i686-unknown-linux-gnu --target i686-unknown-linux-gnu` would pull the Cargo.toml file from the directory above the one I'm working in currently.

I feel this is a million to one bug I hit from a mistake in copy and pasting from my notes however it's always best to have someone with more knowledge look over what I found so someone else doesn't run into it some other way.

Steps to reduce:

1.  `git clone https://github.com/rust-lang/rust.git -b stable && cd rust`
2.  `git clone https://github.com/rust-lang/rust.git -b stable && cd rust`
3.  edit Config.toml for needs
4.  `/x.py dist --build i686-unknown-linux-gnu --host i686-unknown-linux-gnu --target i686-unknown-linux-gnu`

During the build process it would fail with the following tailed output:

`Compiling rust-demangler v0.0.1 (/usr/src/rust/rust/src/tools/rust-demangler)
Finished release [optimized] target(s) in 9.58s
Dist rust-demangler-1.63.0-i686-unknown-linux-gnu
finished in 0.724 seconds
Building stage1 tool cargo-clippy (i686-unknown-linux-gnu)
Finished release [optimized] target(s) in 0.13s
Dist clippy-1.63.0-i686-unknown-linux-gnu
finished in 4.917 seconds
Dist llvm-tools-1.63.0-i686-unknown-linux-gnu
finished in 44.173 seconds
Dist rust-dev-1.63.0-i686-unknown-linux-gnu
finished in 49.951 seconds
Dist extended stage1 (i686-unknown-linux-gnu)
Dist rust-1.63.0-i686-unknown-linux-gnu
finished in 122.080 seconds
error: current package believes it's in a workspace when it's not:
current: /usr/src/rust/rust/./compiler/rustc_codegen_cranelift/Cargo.toml
workspace: /usr/src/rust/Cargo.toml

this may be fixable by adding `rust/./compiler/rustc_codegen_cranelift` to the `workspace.members` array of the manifest located at: /usr/src/rust/Cargo.toml
Alternatively, to keep it out of the workspace, add the package to the `workspace.exclude` array, or add an empty `[workspace]` table to the package's manifest.
Build completed unsuccessfully in 0:16:30`

After being stumped at the message as my toml was fine I noticed that it was using /usr/src/rust/Cargo.toml rather than the one it should be using which should have been /usr/src/rust/rust/Cargo.toml. Simply deleting the /usr/src/rust/Cargo.toml file then rerunning x.py fixed all the issues and resulted in the desired outcome.

As I said I'm not completely sure what caused this but hopefully at least some good can come out of my mistake.

Machine tested on: Gentoo Linux chroot i686 inside a Gentoo Linux x86_64 host.
